thread.title: Chelsea FC news: N’Golo Kante should win PFA Player of the Year, says Gary Neville | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea FC news: N’Golo Kante should win PFA Player of the Year, says Gary Neville | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Chelsea FC news: N’Golo Kante should win PFA Player of the Year, says Gary Neville | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news search metro follow us chelsea

text:
Search Metro Follow us Chelsea midfielder N’Golo Kante should be named PFA Player of the Year, says Manchester United great Gary Neville Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 11:27 pm Chelsea star N’Golo Kante (Picture: Getty) 
Chelsea midfielder N’Golo Kante should be named PFA Player of the Year after his stunning impact at the Premier League leaders, according to Gary Neville. 
Frenchman Kante was shortlisted for the award last year as he helped Leicester City defy odds of 5000/1 to win the title. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
His Leicester team-mate Riyad Mahrez ultimately took home the award but Kante could get his hands on the trophy this year. 
The 25-year-old has been hugely influential in helping Antonio Conte’s Chelsea storm 10 points clear at the top of the table. 
And this, according to Manchester United legend Neville, should see him crowned the PFA Player of the Year. 
When asked to name his pick, Neville said on Monday Night Football: ‘I actually said before that he [Kante] should win it. Alexis Sanchez and Zlatan Ibrahimovic have also enjoyed fine seasons (Pictures: Getty) 
‘His impact on the two teams has been absolutely incredible.
